forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. High near 55, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. South southeast wind around 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. Low around 52, with temperatures rising to around 54 overnight. South southeast wind around 14 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As dusk descends upon Downtown San Francisco, the air is thick with anticipation, laden with the promise of rain that has begun to manifest itself in heavy droplets washing the streets. The gloomy sky hangs low, casting a muted palette across the city, mirroring the chilly embrace of a winter’s evening. Wisps of fog creep along the fringes of the bay, softening the outlines of the Golden Gate Bridge, while the familiar silhouettes of buildings stand resolute against the tempestuous skies. The wind, persistent and lively, whips around, reminding all who wander outside to seek shelter from the encroaching downpour.

In this climate, dressing in layers becomes not just a suggestion but a necessity. A warm, water-resistant coat is advisable, paired with sturdy shoes to navigate the slickened sidewalks. As the temperatures hover around the low fifties, cozying up indoors sounds far more appealing; perhaps indulging in a warm drink at a local café, reveling in the comfort of freshly baked pastries, or immersing oneself in a good book while watching rain splatter against the windows. The evening calls for introspection, inviting moments of stillness amid the world’s thrumming rhythm, as nature washes away both the dust of the day and the sorrows of yesterday.
